turns.content:
Sure, here are 15 ways to receive resident input:

1. Hold regular town hall meetings where residents can voice their opinions and concerns
2. Use suggestion boxes placed in common areas for residents to submit feedback and ideas anonymously
3. Conduct surveys to gather feedback on specific issues or programs
4. Create a social media group or forum for residents to share their thoughts and ideas
5. Use feedback cards that can be filled out and dropped off at a designated location
6. Create a resident advisory committee made up of residents who can provide ongoing input and feedback
7. Use a suggestion board where residents can post ideas and comments for others to see and respond to
8. Conduct focus groups with small groups of residents to gather more detailed feedback on specific issues
9. Have one-on-one meetings with residents to discuss their individual feedback and concerns
10. Use online polling tools to gather quick feedback on specific topics
11. Host regular events or meetings specifically for resident input and feedback
12. Conduct door-to-door outreach to gather feedback from residents who may not feel comfortable sharing their thoughts publicly
13. Use a mobile app or texting service to collect real-time feedback from residents
14. Host open office hours where residents can drop in to share their thoughts and feedback with leadership
15. Conduct regular check-ins with residents to gather ongoing feedback and make sure their needs are being met.
Create 15 examples that follow Goal 4 Success Criteria not based on percent like: "Residents are able to articulate a variety of campus resources. Residents filled out roommate agreements."

1. Resident feedback shows an increase in positive attitudes towards working together as a team.
2. Residents participate in team-building activities at least once per month.
3. Residents demonstrate increased collaboration and cooperation during community events.
4. Residents express a sense of belonging and connection to their living community.
5. Residents show an understanding of each other's strengths and utilize them to accomplish team goals.
6. Residents demonstrate an ability to resolve conflicts effectively within the living community.
7. Resident satisfaction with the level of communication and feedback received from their peers and staff.
8. Residents actively engage in providing constructive feedback and suggestions for community improvement.
9. Residents consistently show respect towards one another and their shared living spaces.
10. Residents demonstrate an increased willingness to help each other out and lend a helping hand.
11. Residents express an appreciation for diversity and actively seek out opportunities to learn from each other.
12. Residents are able to identify and work towards common goals as a team.
13. Residents demonstrate an increased sense of responsibility and ownership over their living community.
14. Residents show an understanding of the importance of teamwork in achieving community goals.
15. Residents actively engage in planning and executing community events together.
GOAL 4 Objective 2 Ideas please list 15 new different options

1. Host a team-building workshop for residents, where they can engage in group activities and learn communication and problem-solving skills.
2. Organize a community service event where residents work together to give back to the community.
3. Set up a mentorship program where upperclassmen residents can guide and support first-year students.
4. Host a game night where residents can bond over board games, card games, or video games.
5. Organize a book club where residents can discuss and share their thoughts on a chosen book.
6. Plan a movie night where residents can watch a movie together and have a group discussion afterwards.
7. Create a cooking club where residents can learn and share cooking tips and recipes with each other.
8. Host a talent show where residents can showcase their talents and skills in a supportive and encouraging environment.
9. Plan a group fitness class or workout session where residents can exercise together and support each other's fitness goals.
10. Organize a cultural event where residents can share and learn about different cultural traditions and customs.
11. Set up a study group or tutoring program where residents can help each other with academic work and assignments.
12. Host a networking event where residents can meet and connect with alumni or professionals in their field of interest.
13. Plan a group outing to a nearby attraction or amusement park for a fun day of bonding and adventure.
14. Create a community garden where residents can work together to grow and maintain plants and vegetables.
15. Organize a DIY workshop where residents can learn and create DIY projects together.

1. Hold a workshop or training session on conflict resolution skills and techniques
2. Encourage residents to engage in open and honest communication with one another
3. Establish a peer mediation program for residents to utilize when conflicts arise
4. Host team-building activities and events to foster positive relationships among residents
5. Provide resources on stress management and coping mechanisms to help residents manage conflict
6. Create a resident council or committee to discuss and address conflicts on the floor
7. Encourage active listening and validation of each other's feelings during conflicts
8. Utilize restorative justice practices to repair harm and rebuild relationships
9. Provide conflict resolution guides and resources for residents to reference when needed
10. Host facilitated discussions to address sensitive or divisive issues within the community
11. Develop a system for anonymous conflict reporting and resolution
12. Encourage and facilitate apologies and forgiveness between conflicting parties
13. Provide regular feedback to residents on their conflict resolution skills and progress
14. Use role-playing exercises to practice conflict resolution and de-escalation techniques
15. Foster a culture of respect and understanding on the floor, where differences are celebrated and conflicts are addressed in a healthy manner.
GOAL 5 Objective 1 Ideas please list 15 new different options

Sure, here are 15 new different options for GOAL 5 Objective 1:

1. Collaborate with a local community center to organize a service project.
2. Host a game night where residents can bond over board games and snacks.
3. Plan a movie night featuring a film with a message of teamwork or collaboration.
4. Host a potluck dinner where residents can share their favorite dishes and cultural traditions.
5. Organize a campus-wide scavenger hunt with prizes for the winning team.
6. Start a book club where residents can discuss books that focus on teamwork and collaboration.
7. Plan a trip to a nearby park or hiking trail for a day of team-building activities.
8. Host a speed-friending event where residents can meet and get to know each other in a fun and casual setting.
9. Organize a talent show where residents can showcase their unique skills and talents.
10. Host a volunteer fair where residents can learn about different opportunities to give back to the community.
11. Plan a wellness day with activities such as yoga, meditation, and healthy cooking classes.
12. Host a "bring your pet" day where residents can show off their furry friends and bond over their love of animals.
13. Organize a community service project such as a park clean-up or food drive.
14. Plan a karaoke night where residents can let loose and have fun singing their favorite songs.
15. Host a cultural fair where residents can share their cultural backgrounds and traditions with each other.
